org.openwms.core.uaa.api

Class UsersController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openwms.core.http.AbstractWebController
      • org.openwms.core.uaa.api.UsersController

  • @Controller
 @RequestMapping(value="/api/users")
public class UsersController
extends org.openwms.core.http.AbstractWebController
    An UsersController represents a RESTful access to Users. It is transactional by the means it is the outer application service facade that returns validated and completed User objects to its clients.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    $Revision: $
    Author:
    Heiko Scherrer

    • Method Detail

      • findAllUsers

        @RequestMapping(method=GET)
 @ResponseBody
public ResponseEntity<org.ameba.http.Response<UserVO>> findAllUsers()
        This method returns all existing Users.

        URI /users
        Verb GET
        Auth YES
        Header

        The response stores User instances JSON encoded. It contains a collection of User objects.

        Returns:
        JSON response

      • create

        @RequestMapping(method=POST)
 @ResponseBody
public ResponseEntity<org.ameba.http.Response<UserVO>> create(@RequestBody @NotNull
                                                                                                          UserVO user,
                                                                                                          HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                                          HttpServletResponse resp)
        Takes a newly created User instance and persists it.

        URI /users
        Verb POST
        Auth YES
        Header

        Request Body 

           {
     "username" : "testuser"
   }

        Parameters:

        • username (String):
          • The unique username.

        Response Body 

           {
     "id" : 4711,
     "username" : "testuser",
     "token" : "876sjh36ejwhd",
     "version" : 1
   }

        • id (Integer (32bit)):
          • The internal unique technical key for the stored instance.
        • username (String):
          • The unique username.
        • token (String):
          • A generated token that is used to authenticate each request.
        • version (Integer (32bit)):
          • A version number used internally for optimistic locking.

        Parameters:
        user - The user to create
        Returns:
        a responseVO
